title: Add code formatter (Prettier + sql-formatter)
description:
Add code formatting support to the editor.

## Libraries
- **Prettier** (standalone): JS, TS, JSX, TSX, CSS, HTML, JSON, Markdown, YAML, GraphQL
- **sql-formatter**: SQL

## Features
- Command `:fmt` or `:format` to format current buffer
- Shortcut `<Space>cf` in normal mode (leader + code + format)
- Respect user's indentation settings (indentType: tabs/spaces, indentSize: 2/4/8)
- Opt-in setting with privacy disclaimer

## UX for unsupported languages
- Show alert/message in status bar when user tries to format unsupported language
- Add icon or tooltip in language selector indicating formatter support

## Implementation Progress

### Done
- [x] Added `formatterEnabled` setting (opt-in, disabled by default)
- [x] Added UI in Settings > Editor with privacy disclaimer
- [x] Added `:fmt` and `:format` commands in vimEngine
- [x] Added `<Space>cf` shortcut in normal mode
- [x] Added `pendingAction` to VimState for component communication
- [x] Added status bar messages for formatting feedback
- [x] Added sparkle icon in language selector (shows when formatter enabled)
- [x] Created formatter.ts with Prettier + sql-formatter integration

### Blocked
- **Chrome UTF-8 encoding error**: When bundling Prettier (~2MB), Chrome fails to load content script with "Could not load file 'content-scripts/content.js' for content script. It isn't UTF-8 encoded."
- CDN approach (esm.sh) blocked by page CSP policies
- File validates as ASCII/UTF-8 with `file` command and Node.js syntax check passes

## Next Steps to Try
1. **Web Worker approach**: Move Prettier to a separate web accessible resource loaded via Web Worker
2. **Investigate Prettier plugins**: Some plugins (especially TypeScript at 874KB) may contain problematic characters
3. **Try alternative bundler settings**: Different minification or encoding options
4. **Consider lighter alternatives**: Use only sql-formatter (works) and simpler JS formatter

## Technical Notes
- sql-formatter works fine when bundled (~300KB)
- Prettier standalone + all plugins = ~2MB
- TypeScript plugin alone is 874KB
- Dynamic imports from CDN blocked by strict CSP on many sites

title: Add indentation settings
description:
Add user-configurable indentation settings to the extension.

## Requirements
- Allow users to configure:
  - Indentation type (tabs vs spaces)
  - Indentation size (2, 4, 8 spaces)
- Settings should be persisted in browser.storage.sync
- Settings should be accessible from the popup settings panel

## Implementation
- Add new fields to configStore.ts
- Update SettingsPanel.tsx with new UI controls
- Apply indentation settings in VimputEditor.tsx
close_reason: Implemented indentation settings: added indentType (tabs/spaces) and indentSize (2/4/8) to configStore, SettingsPanel UI, and VimputEditor Tab handling
